Ref:
When you pass the logical ID of this resource to the intrinsic Ref function, Ref returns the DB instance name.

For more information about using the Ref function, see Ref.

GetAtt.Description: The CA identifier of the CA certificate used for the DB instance's server certificate.
The expiration date of the DB instanceâs server certificate.
The mode of Database Insights that is enabled for the instance.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the DB instance.
The AWS Region-unique, immutable identifier for the DB instance.   This identifier is found in AWS CloudTrail log entries whenever the AWS KMS key for the DB instance is accessed.
The Oracle system ID (Oracle SID) for a container database (CDB).   The Oracle SID is also the name of the CDB. This setting is valid for RDS Custom only.

The connection endpoint for the database. For example: mystack-mydb-1apw1j4phylrk.cg034hpkmmjt.us-east-2.rds.amazonaws.com  For Aurora Serverless DB clusters, the connection endpoint only applies to the DB cluster.
The ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted zone.
The port number on which the database accepts connections. For example: 3306
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the secret. This parameter is a return value that you can retrieve using the Fn::GetAtt   intrinsic function. For more information, see Return values.
